Posts.Title: Ultrasound Monday - What to ask, should I have pushed for MRI? LeeCope15 rrs

Posts.Content: LeeCope15 wrote: Hi there - Confessed stalker over the past week and have already learned so much from so many of you brave women (and men). I am scheduled for an Ultrasound on Monday and feeling concerned that I've made a mistake. A little back story - I am 37 with no previous issues. My mom is a two time survivor first diagnosed at 50 with a reoccurrence at 72. I also have dense breasts. At my last mammogram they recommended a 6 month surveillance alternating between mammogram and MRI. MRI was scheduled for January 2015, however insurance denied it. Because I haven't had an issues, they offered the ultrasound and I said I was fine with that given I haven't had any issues. However (and I promise I am NOT a hypochondriac!) some strange things have been happening: -I have lost 15lbs since October without trying or needing to. I know sounds like a good problem to have, but I small framed and it is more than I am comfortable with (and definitely has changed the size/shape of my breasts) -I have had nipple discharge since before my last mammogram but green/yellow and sticky. They did a prolactin test and all is fine. I assume nothing, but thought I should mention. -I have no breast pain but rather a frequent sensation of milk letting down like when I used to nurse. This is new over the past few months. So, I guess my big question before is Monday is if anything was wrong, would the Ultrasound be enough? I am wondering if I should have pushed insurance for that MRI. Any thoughts? Or, any questions I need to be prepared to ask? Thanks in andvance for all your wisdom! Log in to post a reply
